document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Micropagurus (Crustacea Decapoda Anomura Paguridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Micropagurus (Crustacea Decapoda Anomura Paguridae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material.
Holotype : ♂ , SL = 1.6 mm ,
10 m
, Miyano­hama, Chichijima Island , Ogasawara Islands , coll. Hiroyuki Tachikawa ,
4 Feb. 1995
, CBM­ZC 8378
.
Paratype : 1♂ , SL = 1.5 mm ,
3 m
, Miyano­hama, Chichijima Island , Ogasawara Islands , coll. Hiroyuki Tachikawa ,
16 Apr. 1995
, CBM­ZC 8379
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Micropagurus propinquus
n. sp. : holotype, ♂, SL = 1.6 mm, Chichijima, Ogasawara Islands, CBM­ZC 8378. Shield and cephalic appendages: A, dorsal; B, anterior portion of shield and proximal portions of ocular and antennal peduncles, dorsal; C, right antennule, lateral; D, right antennal peduncle, setae omitted, dorsal; E, same, mesial; F, same, lateral; G, right antennal flagella. H, third maxilliped, left, internal; I, same, basis and ischium, setae omitted. Scales for A–H = 1 mm. Scale for I = 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 4.
Micropagurus propinquus
n. sp. A–D: holotype, ♂, SL = 1.6 mm, Chichijima, Ogasawara Islands, CBM­ZC 8378; E: paratype, ♂, SL = 1.5 mm, same locality, CBM­ZC 8379. Right cheliped: A, lateral; B, dorsal; C, mesial; D, dactyl and fixed finger, dorsal, setae omitted; E, chela and carpus, dorsal. Scales = 1 mm.

FIGURE 5.
Micropagurus propinquus
n. sp. : holotype, ♂, SL = 1.6 mm, Chichijima, Ogasawara Islands, CBM­ZC 8378. Left cheliped: A, mesial; B, chela and carpus, dorsal; C, lateral; D, dactyl and fixed finger, dorsal, setae omitted. Scales = 1 mm.

FIGURE 6.
Micropagurus propinquus
n. sp. : holotype, ♂, SL = 1.6 mm, Chichijima, Ogasawara Islands, CBM­ZC 8378. Left second pereopod: A, lateral; B, dactyl and propodus, mesial. Left third pereopod: C, lateral; D, dactyl and propodus, mesial. Right fourth pereopod: E, lateral, setae omitted. Anterior lobe of sternite of third pereopods: F, ventral. Coxae and sternite of fifth pereopods and anterior portion of pleon: G, ventral. Tergite of sixth pleonal somite and telson: H, dorsal. Scales for A–D = 1 mm. Scales for E­H = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The specific epithet is from the Latin
propinquus
, meaning related or similar, and reflects morphological similarity of this species to
M. devaneyi
.

Remarks: This species is most similar to
M. devaneyi
but is easily distinguished from the latter in having a greater number of corneous spines on the ventral margins of the ambulatory dactyls; in
M. propinquus
, the second pereopods have 4–6 spines ( Fig. 6A, B ), and the thirds have 5–7 spines ( Fig. 6C, D ). However, both the second and third pereopods of
M. devaneyi
have only 2–4 (generally 2 or 3) spines. Additionally, the ventrolateral margin of the merus of the left cheliped is unarmed in
M. devaneyi
. However, the same margin of
M. propinquus
is armed with 1 strong spine in proximal half and 1 smaller spine near distal margin ( Fig. 5C ). Generally, spines on the chelipeds and the carpi of the ambulatory pereopods of
M. propinquus
are much stronger than those of
M. devaneyi
.
